Reviews.AuthorLocation: New Port Richey, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay there - What year is it?”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: We tried to stay there as part of a timeshare offer. We checked out after a few hours - we just couldn't handle the odors. In the lobby they have large fans set up to try and dry out the carpet and get rid of the musty smell. I think that smell has been there for a very long time and is not leaving that easily. Our room was on the 5th floor, and the hallway had a different smell. A cross between mildew and gym locker. The room: First of all, they give you 2 actual metal keys. One for the deadbolt, and one for the door handle. Seriously. When we walked in, there was an overwhelming smell of bleach and the tile was wet. I always bring a container of Lysol wipes with me, and headed straight to the bathroom to clean it. Wow is all I can say. Apparently, the staff pours bleach on the floor to make guests think the room has been cleaned. Trust me, that toilet was not touched for a very, very long time. I used the entire container to clean a small bathroom. The rest of the room was just grimy and never really cleaned. There was a bobby pin on the carpet in the living room, and when I touched the bedside lamp I almost cried from the slime on my fingers. The furniture and fixtures are cheap and old. I felt sorry for the newer tv in the armoire, it didn't deserve to be there. The hotel itself is completely outdated - think 1960's - and run down. It was like a really bad summer camp for grown-ups. I think they are trying to renovate it, but it needs a complete remodel. They were busy, though, so maybe I'm just too particular - LOL.

Reviews.Title: “A work in progress!”
Reviews.Author: Aggie T
Reviews.Content: Here for a week with son and his family. So far all is good. On our 2nd day. Pretty clean and everything works fine! Beach and pools clean and nice. Game room could use modernizing and sprucing up a bit. Need some activities for kids. Movies at night nice for families. I think this place is making an effort to improve. Traded our week thru interval. Hoping balance of stay continues to be pleasant as last 2 have been!

Reviews.Title: “run down”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: We have not stayed here for years and were disapointed to find the place in such run down condition. There was food left in the unit from who knows when. We had two coffee pots, one in worse shape than the other. This was replaced with one not much better. Should have bought one at Wal Mart for $10. The people working around the resort were dressed like beach bums, kind of scarry. Front desk depole dressed apropriately. Went to check in early told to come back at 2:00 without even checking to see if unit was available, sure enough it was available. I can see how, bathroom was not clean, hair and grime on the floor. This is a great location but does not meet average standards. Sorry to say we are owners here thru Inverval Internationsl. We use our unit for trade and it does have good trading power. We will continue to trade and stay away. Yes, where does our maintenance fees go? The restaurant is dark and dingy, wouldn't order anything there.

Reviews.Title: “A bit outdated but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Wobblything
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my time here even though the resort itself is a bit outdated and could do with a little TLC. The room was clean and well-equipped, the pools were clean (although the indoor poor was a little too hot for my liking) and the outdoor area pleasing. The Tiki Bar on the beach was fantastic and the atmosphere outside was brilliant. A laundry is located in the basement for those staying for longer periods of time. The resort is RIGHT on the beach and conveniently located close to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service, but renovations are moving too slow!”
Reviews.Author: eaglemom2
Reviews.Content: This is our home resort through Interval International and we have been exchanging for other locations for the past 10 years or so. This year we thought it was about time we check out the place where all our maintenance fees go to! Even though we have been receiving newsletters about the many "renovations" that have been going on at the Americano, we were concerned with negative reviews we read on Trip Advisor. In making our reservation I mentioned this to the rep and she was glad to put in a request for a "renovated room". Upon our arrival some of the issues we read about were true: there was a moldy, musty odor as you entered the lobby and the furniture, decor and lighting were out-dated, of poor quality and not appealing at all. (Later on we had a discussion with the front desk manager who explained that the odor comes from guests who walk through the lobby dripping wet from the pool or the beach and it is a constant source of moisture. They put floor drying fans around to help dry it out. The decor in the lobby is of low priority because they are concentrating most of their efforts on individual room renovations.) Our room did have new curtains, bedding, and mattresses but the carpet always felt damp and the room divider doors did not work properly. We had a beautiful view of the beach and the pool but were disappointed with the lack of a balcony. The AC unit only seemed to cool off the bedroom and not the sofa bed area - suggestion: a simple fix would be to add a ceiling fan over the living room. The kitchenette was smaller than what we have seen at other timeshares and some of the cabinets did not close well. The bathroom was in good shape although we noticed a constant odor from day one. The tile work looked out-dated but everything worked properly and showers were satisfactory. (We learned later on that all the tubs had been resurfaced recently) Although the housekeeping staff was quite friendly on the phone and at the towel exchange room we found dust and sand around our TV in the armoire. They also insisted on using their walkie-talkies at the highest volume outside our door on check-out day. Even with our late check-out request they made noise and banged on our door early in the am. Also, we were harassed by "member services" every morning about 8 am by phone to ask when they could set up an "in-room" survey appointment. We explained we arrived late the night before and were sleeping in but they insisted on calling back the next day. I explained that we were not comfortable having anyone in our room for a survey as we were all spread out and trying to relax in our room. The rep was rude and obnoxious and evasive when I asked why this was so important. They finally left us alone after 3 days of constant phone calls. I complained to the front desk and they said although they are not affiliated with "member services" they would pass along a message to them that they were disturbing us. They also suggested we fill out a comment card so that it would be in writing. We did that and turned it in. In spite of all that, I would have to say the most positive experience was from the front desk staff and their manager. We were greeted with a smile when we checked in late at night and was assisted with the automatic door so we could bring in our luggage. It was a speedy and polite check-in process. During our stay other issues came up and the front desk was apologetic and willing to help in any way they could. Even the manager took about 20 minutes of her time to discuss with us how they are working hard every year to try to renovate/update this old resort. They are accessing each room and prioritizing any issue that needs immediate attention. Almost all now have new curtains and bedding as well as the resurfaced tubs. They are also working on re-opening a convience store on property to provide guest with items they may need in their room, such as coffee, sugar, milk,etc. (something we needed during our stay, instead of driving down the road for) Even though the Tiki Bar was a great themed eatery for lunch or dinner it was still a "bar" atmosphere and not as "family friendly" feeling. It would be nice to see the "Bistro" re-open to have a casual eatery for breakfast or lunch. We were told it was run by an outside company who closed it down and the resort had no control over it. We enjoyed our time at Daytona Beach and visiting with relatives in the area. This is what makes it such a great location for our family but we would like to see more progress made with the renovations when we return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: Jesse G
Reviews.Content: This is my second time I've been here, and it has gotten better. They added HD Televisions, a tiki bar, and a restaurant. It sounds like a nice place, and it certainly is. It has some nice rooms, though the smell from just walking in it was so bad, we had to spray some fragrance to actually make it bearable. The beds were comfortable, the couch was also comfortable, and the TV was nice to look at, too. The outdoor pool was amazing. The temperature was just right, and the pool is very wide open so many people can swim in it and have fun. It's really deep, too, about up to ten feet, maybe more. The indoor pool is basically intended for kids so they can swim in a shallow pool. I wasn't able to be in the hot tub, though, because I was too young to be in it (18 and older to be able to step in it.) My parents wouldn't go to the restaurant and tiki bar, but it smells really good just being outside of it, smells like their grilling hamburgers. :) What was better is that right when you leave the restaurant, you are near the entrance to the beach. The lobby seems crowd until you go farther down the lobby, it seems so empty, because the bar is always closed, maybe due to rearranging and all that, but the TV at the bar is always on which is weird. Overall, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Week 27 Family Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Deb3182
Reviews.Content: Regular week 27 guest. Was very disappointed this year with a "noise ordinance" ban on the resort that kept us from having the normal daily and nightly music and activities. The pools and hot tubs now have a closing time- which disprupted my normal nightly exercise swim and quick jump in the hot tub before bed. It was truly a different place this year- felt more like a hotel than a resort! Definetly will miss the activities!!! But I will continue to go 27th week because of the bonds of the families that all go the same time each year. Also, this year the resort has "gone green" and are limiting towels and linen exchange days. I totally understand protecting our planet but I find there are other ways to go green than being a towel warden! Also, there are now laundry hours- so no more washing clothes at night- isn't that supposed to be the cheapest time of the day to wash and dry clothes?(speaking of going green!) The pool deck this year looked rough and the pool did not seem to be cleaned daily as it was in the past. Also, there was smoking allowed by the pool and no ash trays around the pool and people left there cigarette butts and ashes around the pool- disgusting! I must say The rooms were looking better and cleaner this year. Still need to get rid of the hideous vases of fake flowers and update the decor!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tiki Bar/ restaurant at the resort”
Reviews.Author: Expat2005SA
Reviews.Content: This place is outdated BUT it has a lot to offer. There is a good size laundry room, a few organized games for the kids during the summer. In-door and out-door pool and hot tub which was nice. Since most people dont feel like getting dressed to go out for lunch or even up to ones room, there is a nice tiki bar/restaurant right on the property. Food was good and reasonably priced. That was the best part. Our room was a nice size and the kitchen was fully equipped. Front desk staff were helpful. The pool area (not the pool though) needed updating - paint was peeling and some walls at the top needed repairing. (there are a few photos that someone posted)

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Beattl
Reviews.Content: Had three units for my family, one bedroom and 2 two bedrooms. Units were clean and comfortable and plenty of room! The resort itself could use a little facelift but overall it was good. Nice big outdoor pool and also an indoor pool that came in handy as the weather was bad a couple of days ! Beach access was good. Never used the restaurant at the resort, so I can' t really rate that. The resort also had a very nice exercise room! Parking was good, but if you have more than one car in a unit you might have to park across the street. We did not have any problems with parking.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Americano”
Reviews.Author: Madka2
Reviews.Content: We have been going for 15+ years. This is a great place with wonderful guests and staff:) july 4th week is the best. After reading several reviews I am disappointed but not surprised by some people.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Saved the Americano”
Reviews.Author: lorraine k
Reviews.Content: We had two "condos", one for us and the other for our daughter and friend who were in their late 20's. Both were on the same floor but were very different. Neither were that nice but they were relatively clean. I bought air fresheners and fabreze to deal with the odour. They worked very well. Pool towels were the size of dish towels, so we all went out and purchased our own pool towels. They should remove all the plastic flowers from the rooms, as they are fake and faded looking and rennovate the bathroom and kitchen. Bed, pillows and sheets were not that comfortable. But the bed was big. The staff was nice and helpful with all of us. The wrist band provided for the pool area was too small for my husband and he could not wear it. They need to have different sizes available as they were also too big for the girls. The place does need some major repairs, around the pool, the rooms and reception. What saved it for us was the location. The beach was great, we walked to the pier and restaurants, could make margarittas in our room to take to the pool (blenders provided) and the on site tikki bar was very handy and pretty good. The out door pool, while needing work on the deck area, was very nice to swim in, was clean and the water a comfortable temperature. The bedroom and kitchen had great ocean views, but a balcony would have been really nice. We sat by the pool instead. While we wouldn't stay there again, the younger crowd may as they don't spend much time in the room and are not as concerned about a comfortable bed with nice soft sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sheryl d
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure who has the misunderstanding at staying here me or them! I felt like I was at home doing my own cleaning and washing towels. I assumed that maid service would come by each day to exchange out towels and take trash but found out after using every towel we had that they didn't provide that. I had missed towel exhange which is from 8 until 11 and it's done by odd/even day according to your room SO I had to buy laundry detergent and PAY for washing and drying in the laundry room or we would have had no towels. They advertise a lounge/breakfast lobby which is closed until May which would have been open only from 8 until 10. What place can't give you a somewhere to get coffee or a small complimentary cup at most. They would sell me a pack for a $1.00 and I could make my own. I don't know about you but when I am on vacation I do not want to be washing and drying towels or making anything on my own. It is OLD - it is clean but the era of decor makes you feel like it's not. No way would I walk around without my flip flops in the room. I am just confused on if it's a condo rental type or half hotel service. Some positive things, huge pool with lots of chairs, AWESOME beach access, tiki bar entertainment has some improvement but is nice in having a drink and sitting out being that there is no lounge. Leaves a lot to desired for a nice place to stay on vacation. Trust me when I tell you to find somewhere else unless where you stay does not matter and you are there just for sun and fun. I like amentities and niceness and did not want to be in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd read the other reviews before staying here..”
Reviews.Author: D3K2
Reviews.Content: Made the spontaneous decision to stay overnight in Daytona Beach since the weather was so spectacular. We got two connecting rooms for our party of 6. Everything about the resort needs work. The rooms are very dated, like 1975-dated. The rooms did have new tile on the floors and newer TV's but otherwise in serious need of updating. The light switches for the bathrooms were on the outside of the rooms which my kids threatened to torment each other with whenever anyone was in there! The toilet seats were white but the toilets themselves were yellow, leading me to instinctively flush them every time I walked by! (Why would anyone even make a yellow toilet?) The beds were extremely hard (my personal deal-breaker) and the linens were scratchy. The pillows however, were nice. Thankfully, the rooms were both very clean. There were no balcony's but the windows did open. We opted not to open them because what little window ledge there was, was covered with bird droppings. The pool and pool deck are large but the pool is not heated. Indoor pool was warmer than outdoor, but both hot tubs were good. Nice beach access too. There was a snack brain the lobby where we intended to get something small for breakfast, the posted hours were 8:00-10:00 am. However, it was closed when we got down there at 9:40. In general, the service was good, everyone was friendly and prompt to assist. And I will say that there seemed to be a lot of work going on in the pool area and around a new Tiki Bar on the beach, so they are trying.

Reviews.Title: “One Week Stay - Great time”
Reviews.Author: ssmarie2005
Reviews.Content: This resort is older however they keep working to refresh the rooms and keep it clean. Staff are very nice and outgoing. Outdoor pool is not heated however there is an indoor pool and 2 hot tubs. There are plenty of deck chair and it is sheltered from the windy ocean breezes so you can work on your tan. I liked having a kitchen in my room and basic utensils and dishes were provided. If you need more all you need to do is call housekeeping. Plenty of activities for seniors and for those of us who are younger, it's in a great location for those day trips. Great memories from this trip and I would recommend this hotel. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Gstew78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom through RCI. It was the oddest designed room we have ever stayed in. The bathroom was right at the front door and was far away from the bedroom and the light switches to the bathroom were on the outside wall in the living room. Th bathroom was so tiny you could barely get out of the shower without touching the sink. Upon checking in I found lots of hair in the bathroom and the carpet just looked nasty and the room didn't smell great either. The pool area is ok but this is not a great place to stay. This was the first time I ever wanted to go home early on vacation. Also no rooms in this place have a balcony so you can't sit and look out at the ocean. Avoid this place, you won't feel clean the whole time you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: kpkeyser
Reviews.Content: I got someone's timeshare week for the week of Thanksgiving for a great price because they couldn't make it. I read the reviews and didn't expect much. When I arrived I couldn't believe how nice the place was. Yes it is an older building and it had an order in the lobby but my room had no odor and it was spotless as was the resort. The gentleman that checked me in was extremely friendly and even made an effort to get me in 3 1/2 hrs early for check in. The 2 pools and 2 hot tubes were both very nice. You could tell they have done a lot of renavations. A blacony would have been nice but no big deal. We stopped in the bar and grill for 25 cent wings it was a nice little place and service was great. It is about a mile from the boardwalk which is a nice beach walk and about a mile from Publix shopping center. My husband liked it so well He wants to take the grandkids back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “More Suited As An Indiana State University Dormitory”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Eleanor_Knight
Reviews.Content: My housemates, Linda Batchelor-Ballew and her husband, Pete; their friend, Patrick Doherty; and I stayed at the Americano Beach Resort in Daytona Beach for two nights during September 2011. While the location was very ideal, being right next to the beach, the hotel was very dated and reminded me too much of Rhodes Hall, the dormitory at Indiana State University in Terre Haute where I stayed in 1978 as a participant of Special Olympics (and where I later went in 1984 for a campus visit during high school; thankfully, I never attended ISU). The rules were also very authoritarian, as Americano's "brown book" stated that we had to put the dishes in the dishwasher upon check-out and have every item inspected, as if we were moving into a campus dormitory. Even worse, the water was shut off for some emergency reason at 11 AM during the second morning of our stay; the elevators reeked of bad seafood odor; and the on-premises convenience store was never open. We also had to memorize a special code to access any part of the premises, starting with the front door. (For me, that was easy, since it was one of my old residence addresses. What a joke!) While we will undoubtedly return to Daytona Beach, we will be avoiding this joint like the plague. Too bad, since there were some decent pools and hot tubs on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Great time of year to visit”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: I am here from 9/24/11 to 10/01/11. I booked this vacation last minute through RCI and friend's time share. I am pleased with the room. View is great, but disappointed there is no balcony. I am over the pool, noise has not been an issue, but this is not the busy season, which is fine for me. Bedroom gets very hot if you don't keep curtains pulled. Coffee maker did not have correct working parts, so they brought me a new one. Refrigerator motor was loud, I have reported that. I got here on Saturday, ran out of toilet paper on Tuesday, had two rolls, not full rolls. I called to get more, was told I could go to laundry area in basement, I stated, I don't think so, I have a 3 year old with me and cannot leave. Thought that was strange. Toilet paper arrived in 5 minutes. Also when I take a shower, the water goes cold, can't stand that. I reported that. We were without water yesterday all day, I was aware this was going to happen but still have the cold water issue while taking a shower. RCI states they are requiring Americano to upgrade their rooms. I know they were working on the 9th floor, I am on the 8th but did not disturb me since I was out during the day. I am amazed they dont give you info as to what sites are recommened but I am familiar enough with area to know where to go. I also prefer laundry in my room, I will not go down to use public laundry area. All in all, I am pleased with my vacation this trip but again, I think that I went at time of year, not crowded, not dealing with a lot of children, no parties.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a sea view, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Gloria W
Reviews.Content: We book through a veterans discount program, so we don't expect to get the top of the line accommodations, but we do expect a clean room devoid of mold, mildew and smells. Many issues....dirty dishes in the cupboard, musty smell, broken towel rack, "whistling leaky windows", strange door locking system, dirty toilet rim, had to open oven door so we could load the dishwasher, uncomfortable furniture. On the plus side....the tv's were flat screen, but the reception on one of the tv's was snowy. The pool was okay, but there was evidence of decay in the shelter area. We were also stalked by annoying phone calls insisting we talk to someone to complete a survey about the resort. We checked out two days early and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Appalled & Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel0914
Reviews.Content: The resort and the rooms are atrocious. Our room had fecal matter in the shower, left over food in dishes that were rotten. The smell was gastly, from the food as well as the room had a stale odor. Two teens were taken to the hospital due to a pool malfunction, the hot tub outside was not in working order. The decor is out dated, worn out furniture and the springs in the sofa bed were sticking out. The best part of our vacation was the beach and the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Worst trip ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MAB5
Reviews.Content: At first, when we arrived, we thought, "Ok, this looks good." Then the loud music started and lasted until way into the night--and on one night it last all night. Hardly a place for a family with little ones who need their sleep. If you like walking around all day with a Bud Light in your hand, and if you like loud music and rude people, then this is the place for you. The management permits people to "reserve" lounge chairs by the pool 24/7--so you if you are a new guest, you never get to sit by the pool...if you watch all day, you will see that no one really is sitting in those lounge chairs. The view from the rooms is great--that's about it. We threw everything in the dishwasher just to make sure all the dishes/utensils were clean. Then there's Mike, the desk manager, who is rarely at the desk when you need him...overall, not good...we will never return, and we will let Interval know what a poor choice this place is for a timeshare exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't sure what to expect, but despite a few complaints, we'd return to Americano Beach Lodge Resort.”
Reviews.Author: dalejrfan14
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Americano Beach Lodge Resort & after reading a lot of the reviews prior to our trip, we weren't sure what to expect. Despite a few complaints, we had a nice vacation & would return again. Here are just a few pros/cons you may want to consider before booking your vacation there. Guest staying at the Americano was like one big family. Many of the people we talked to had been staying there for over 20 years. Everyone was very friendly, but it was like we were attending a huge family reunion...in fact, it felt like we were attending a continuous party for 7 days. There was a lot of drinking & loud music...we like to have a good time, but it was a little un-expectant & at times a bit inappropriate. But, we did attend the week of July 4th & I'd say that is their busiest time. I talked with a lady on the first day that had spent the previous week at the resort & she said the previous week had been very quiet. So in all fairness, I’d say that the partying isn’t as bad at other times of the year. The pool areas were nice & the resort offered lots of activities for children & adults throughout the week. One negative was that adults had to wear poor bracelets anytime they were at the pool...needless to say; trying to tan with a black silicone bracelets was a bit uncomfortable. Another bit of advice, if you’re going to the pool, put your towels out early in the morning or you will not get a chair. Many of the guests reserve their pool chairs for the day, even if they aren’t going to be there. There were many days that we had to sit far away from the pool area all because the chairs were reserved for guests off doing other activities. The cleaning staff doesn't knock themselves out to get the room spotless...we had to wipe down the kitchen walls, etc. before we put our stuff out. Little areas, like the underside of the soap dish in the shower/bath had mildew on it (very obvious when you are giving a little one a bath) & the toilet rim had not been cleaned. Our biggest complaint was that the AC unit had mold growing in it! We didn't notice this right away, but when we went to adjust the AC & bent over to look closer, you could see big clumps of mold growing on the inside vents. Also, our refrigerator leaked on the inside so every time we got something out of it, it was soaking wet. Despite these things, we made the best of the situation & had a great week. We didn't complain to the staff. Instead, we cleaned these things ourselves & lived w/the leaking fridge. For the money, Americano has a lot to offer & we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: gotoing
Reviews.Content: Located right on the beach, but about 2 miles away from any good restaurants or bars. The resort had a Tiki bar, but it was pretty lame, no fish on the menu and it's tucked away under the resort, no view of the ocean or pool unless you go outside. The rooms were VERY dated and the beds were a little on the firm side. The staff was very friendly and helpful. NOTHING TO DO in the immediate area. Thank goodness we had a car. The beach was very nice but would probably not go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: mudpuppy357
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best managed places we have ever stayed. The staff are very friendly and helpful and obviously very well trained. The facilities are excellent and all are exceptionally maintained. The units are very clean and spacious and the linen service is above excellent. Every year there are improvements . This year the entrance has been upgraded and a excellent tiki bar opened that exits right out to the beach. maintenance items if they arise ( which is seldon ) are dealt with immediately and with quality workmanship. The outdoor pool area is very large and there is an abundance of seating available both around the pool and on the rest of the deck. There is abundant parking on site for the residents and an area for any guest you have is available just across the road. The indoor pool is heated and the well equipped fitness area is clean and equipment well maintained

Reviews.Title: “romatic getaway for two”
Reviews.Author: ShawnW2991
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Daytona beach for our honeymoon in 2009, we had such a great time we went back for our one year anniversary .We stayed at the Americano Beach Resort , there is alot to do in the area and the staff is so nice .This year they had a new tiki bar and they were updating the restrooms it was so nice. to see .They even wished us a happy anniversay on the marque totally want to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “BEST ON-THE-BEACH VALUE”
Reviews.Author: ruby1951
Reviews.Content: hey, my sisters and I spent a week here and had a great time. It is being upgraded and we are impressed with the improvements. Every employee treated us with great regard. I have been an owner for ten years and am relieved to see the improvements. There were some times in years gone by that I thought it was really going downhill. You could stay on the beach in a more expensive venue but this totally meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place we have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Clemgreg30
Reviews.Content: So we stayed at the Americano Beach "Resort" (aka motel) through RCI. This is hands down the worst place we have ever stayed in our years of traveling. When we first arrived, the front doors wouldn't open beacuse you need a "special" pass code to get into the doors as well as through the gates in the "resort." Our pass code was given to us written down in black marker on the back of a random piece of paper. We checked in and were promptly handed our keys...yes keys...not key card..and you needed two keys because one opened and locked the door and the other was for the dead bolt. The decor is plastic flowers...the 50cent kind that no one wants to look at. The "resort" seems to be in a very run down part of the A1A and there is nothing within walking distance. We slept on top of the covers and in our clothes because we were just plain afraid. Also, there was no shampoo at all...but we had at least 5 bars of "ocean mist" scented soap. No light in the shower (it was like taking a shower in the dark), filthy windows, and multiple chunks of cleaning staff hairs on towels were enough to set us over the edge. We were scheduled to stay for 7 nights and just barely lasted one. We immediately checked out the next day without any questions from the staff. DO NOT STAY HERE! You would be better off sleeping on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Check the facts”
Reviews.Author: guardian29750
Reviews.Content: As I have noticed with all the other reviews some have had issues with cleanliness. While this is a problem the biggest problem is that they employ ex-cons. I enjoyed the capability to let my children play on the ship and pool but was very disappointed when I asked for the credentials of those instructing the water aerobics class and when asked how safe my items were going to be in the room. Apparently from what the one maid told me she was employed through day labors and it was because she had a criminal record that is why she didn't work on the books. So as much as I liked some of what they offered I was disappointed to find out I who would be walking through my room. I don't know what the employees backgrounds are but I don't like having my small child around individuals that have a criminal record. I will not return back even though I wish I could. If they could gurantee me that there wasn't someone working there that does not have a criminal record then I will return back. Good luck to all who travel through this place.

Reviews.Title: “needs some updating, but staff made for excellent time”
Reviews.Author: john48723
Reviews.Content: Had read varying reviews so was a little concerned, but aside from resort and rooms needing an upgrade overall experience was excellent. Especially loved the new tiki bar under the sun deck and poolside drink service. Came with wife, 2 young teenagers and 7 yr old. Pool and beach access was great, also had direct view of beach from room. Kids activities was limited, but little one enjoyed what she did. Staff was more than helpful with everything. Not thrilled with pay laundry, $1.50 for wash or dry.

Reviews.Title: “This place is ready for demolition!”
Reviews.Author: Cardjrob
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to say but this former hotel converted to a so called resort is very dated and poorly maintianed. the rooms felt dirty and was awakened by a RAT at 1:30 am. We were moved to another romm but this place has seen better days. It was originally constructed in the early 60's and need a total rebuild. This is absolutely the worst place we have ever stayed in the 15+ years of vacationing. The only good thing I can say is that the pool area was ok. I would not reccomend anyone to stay at the "Americano Resort"

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I would stay again and again and again !!”
Reviews.Author: beachnut57
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner since 19997 and have NEVER had the negative experiences some talk about. The bed could be a little nicer,maybe update some appliances, other than that it has been great for us. I have other friends that own there as well and we all like the place. It is clean and i feel safe when there. As for Floxy she has been nothing but nice to me and our friends. Some people just cant be pleased, it is an older time share but kept up nicely...looking foward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover10007
Reviews.Content: We own a Seabreeze unit here and have owned this unit for approximately 13 years. Up until the last 2 years we have stayed there every year. We haven't stayed at the resort since 6/08 however, we are going down 4th of July this year. I have been reading a lot of the comments and it is very disturbing. I know the last time we were there is was awesome. The staff were very helpful and we love the location and activities that are offered, there was always something to do. So far our experience this year has been good and we haven't even arrived yet. We decided that we wanted to check in 1 day early and with it being race week and 4th of July we did not think it would be possible. However, we called the resort and the gentleman I spoke with was very helpful, reserved us a unit for Friday night and even gave us a discount on the rate. I know they have been doing a lot of upgrades and in the past all of the improvements have been awesome. This resort is by no means a 5 star resort but it is clean, comfortable and convenient. Great for families with children. I have stayed at 5 stars resorts in Daytona, one being Oceanwalk and the service and friendliness of the staff at Americano far exceeds that of other resorts. The only complaints that I have are they are removing the murphy beds from the Seabreeze units, and the biggest complaint for me is there are no washer/dryers in the units. I would highly recommend Americano to anyone visiting the Daytona Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat...”
Reviews.Author: colbs714
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week stay at the Americano. My parents have been owners for nearly 20 years, and speak highly of it year after year. We have traded their unit for weeks in Orlando and California at high end resorts, so I was concerned after reading the reviews that the Americano would be a huge disappointment. I was WRONG! Are there things that can be improved? Absolutely. But overall, we had a wonderful vacation, and really enjoyed our stay. Reasons to Stay: 1. Location. The Americano is right on the beach, and there is even beach access directly from the main deck. The Americano gives you a passcode and bracelets to monitor those actually staying at the resort from someone just wandering in from the beach. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping areas on the A1A strip. The Main Street pier (which is actually closed until the fall, but lots to see and do nearby) is probably only a 20-25 minute walk down the beach. 2. Beach view. At least from our room (we stayed in a Floridian) our bedroom faced the ocean. Our room did not have ceiling to floor windows like the Atlantic rooms, but there was something very calming about falling asleep to the waves every night and watching the sunrise in the morning. 3. Pools. This resort only has one outside pool, but it goes up to 10 ft!! Personally, I prefer this vs. resorts that have 5 pools that go to 4 ft. max. (at least 3 of which I would probably never get to anyways). There are a good number of lounge chairs on the deck. The indoor pool was comfortably warm, and we found ourselves in that one quite often, especially at night. There was also a kiddie pool, which my 3.5 year old went in from time to time. 4. The Staff. Like every resort there is always one or two that you question, but everyone was very nice and accomodating. My parents actually decided to stay an extra few days, and the staff worked it out so my parents could stay in the same room. 5. Comfort. One night during a thunderstorm, we found ourselves in the room next to the lobby sharing a bottle of wine, ordering chinese food and dancing to the jutebox. Simply put, whether you are indoors or out, it's a relaxing and fun place to be. Improvements: 1. The beds and pillows. Honestly, they were uncomfortable. Our discomfort could also be attributed to us sleeping with our window open every night so we could hear the sound of the ocean. Hopefully the new mattresses that were being delivered are better than their predecessor. 2. Some amenities in the unit need to be replaced. For instance, the fan unit above our stove was a bit rusty and some of the countertop appliances were a bit older. But everything was in working order, so it's really only an appearance issue. 3. I missed having a washer and dryer in the room (I traveled with a 3.5 year and 7 month old) but there is at least one on premises. Simply put, this is not a 5 star resort. It's simple and classic, but very usable and practical. The room itself was fine. It was clean (including the tub) and spacious. We had a flat screen in the living room. I am starting to believe that regardless of the stars a resort has, someone will always be unhappy. I understand that some complaints are legitimate, but there was nothing about my stay that would keep me from returning to the Americano. In fact, we look forward to returning to see how the bar area/restaurant that they are building turns out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, just bad all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: llatinamama
Reviews.Content: We bought this timeshare and this was our first experiencs owning one. It was cold that week so we did alot of indoor pool swimming and game room trips. We met another couple while we were there and that made the trip tolerable. We were there only one day, the beds were horrible, when we asked for another room (the place was almost empty) we were gtod "no" and given a bed topper!! Then we started smelling something "rotten" in the rooms, my daughter (6) strated becoming phisically ill by day three, the couple we met (who were having the sam experience) were told that there was a dead rodent in the vent and that's where the smell came from. When I went to request a different room, we were told, "NO" then We had to complain again the next day and when we demanded something be done because my husband works in pest control and knows it's a health hazard breathing the fumes (at this point we all were feeling sick) they offered a 2 br suite. We decided to just leave and go back home. They comped us a measly free week to return to the resort within one year but I WOULD NEVER GO BACK, EVEN IF IT IS FREE!! We have tried to sell it since then but they say you have to have their approval. I will not pay a dime of maintenance fees, the place is a dump, with the worst customer service in the world!! We have other time shares (since then) we bought and they are nowhere near as bad as this hell hole!!

Reviews.Title: “AmericanNONONONONONO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Slainte2U
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Vacation Club owners who used the RCI exchange privileges for 8 days at the Americano. It was awful. The weather was beautiful, and we had a great time being with three of our grown children (in their 20's), but the actual resort was terrible. We arrived around 7:30pm and were given, apparently, the last room available. The furnishings are doggy, the kitchen drawers, cabinets, and appliances are old, scratched and rusty, the very old televisions had screen damage, the bathroom wasn't exactly clean (a big clump of hair was sitting in the drain and the floor had hair and general dirt on it), and the bed had only a fitted sheet over the plastic-encased, very uncomfortable mattress while the cotton blanket had a 9" hole in it. This was totally unacceptable for the amount of points that we had used, and compared to lovely resorts we had previously stayed during the same time period (spring break week). We complained, nicely, to the very cordial staff and were given another room the next afternoon (two staff members apologized for the room we were given..i.e. Oh, yea, room ###. We're really sorry we gave you THAT one.). The new room was a bit cleaner; at least there was a mattress pad and no obvious hair in the the bathrooms, but the above run-down conditions still existed. The overall feeling was that this resort is badly neglected. The indoor hot tub was a unpleasant and foamy green (and extremely hot), the pool deck area needed painting from the rusty stains so prevalent, and the interior hallways smell of the garbage from the mini-dumpster containers at the end of each corridor. YUCK! The fitness room, however, is very clean and nice. We were shocked to find NO screens in any window (quite the safety hazard, I would think). We knew that there were no balconies, but to not have a screen to at least bring attention to a potential fall hazard is an accident that WILL happen. The resort seems to be in a slightly "seedy" area. There is nowhere to go within walking distance, not that I would recommend walking around there, anyway. I feel that this place should not even be listed in the RCI exchange directory. It is substandard. For the points and/or your money, we would recommend avoiding this place and going up to Ormond if you're interested in the Daytona area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: Traci1972
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and large. There is no housekeeping service unless you pay for it, so we did not have to worry about someone else in our room besides us. We were not asked even once to sit through a time share presentation! AWESOME! And we had a great view of the ocean from our 9th story room. The sunrises were incredible. The indoor pool was also very warm, which is a nice change from most hotel pools, but the hot tub was blazing hot. Don't toss your pool braceletsin the trash upon leaving our they will cost you $5 each. We hope to come here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible beach vacation at Americano!”
Reviews.Author: flabbyVa
Reviews.Content: My family, including two teens, had an awesome vacation at Americano Beach Resort. Check in was fast and overall service was fantastic. We had a beautiful Oceanfront room with glass from floor to ceiling. Very nice (like new) furnishings, carpet, bath, countertops, etc. The resort is right on beautiful Daytona Beach. What a great beach for sunning and swimming. All I can say is the pool is Huge! Has deep end too that the teens loved the most. Shaded area on vast deck if you like that too. Big workout gym, indoor pool and hot tubs as well. Close to all Daytona attractions too. Overall we had a geat time at Americano.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: kmfitzgerald
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week-long stay at this property. We enjoyed the accommodations and the ocean views. The large swimming pool was not heated, so very few people swam outside all week. The outside pool was freezing cold! The hot tubs were for those 18 years and older, but weren't supervised well, so children used them every day. The beach was beautiful and there was always something fun going on around the outside pool. The place isn't fancy, but it is clean, spacious and comfortable in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Victoryone
Reviews.Content: Staff The staff at the Americano are the best. They are very customer service oriented and what to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Check-in was quick and painless. They had my reservation and even accommodated me with an ocean view room. The Hotel This is not a 5 star facility so if that's what you are looking for you may want to reconsider; however, the lobby area is nicely decorated. There is Internet access in the lobby area. I thought the bathrooms were a little dated, but they were functional. The rooms were nice and large. I had a two bedroom which had 1 large fridge with a freezer. The layout was similar to having two connecting rooms, which made it convenient so that guests in the other section has access to their own fridge, microwave, bathroom, and towels. There were three (3) televisions, one in each bedroom and one in the sitting area that was equipped with a sofa and chair. The bed was very comfortable (both king size) and the pillows were the best I'd ever used while away from home. The pool goes from 3ft to 10ft with plenty of pool chairs. There is a deck where you can sit down and look out on the ocean. To access the beach, you just punch in a code. This helps to prevent those who are not hotel patrons from using the hotels facilities. This made me feel very safe. Also, you can sit on the deck and look out into the ocean. This was especially relaxing for me. The hotel has a small arcade room where you can play arcades or shoot pool. Food This hotel does not have a full service resturant. There is a Bistro on site where you can get a quick breakfast sandwich, cereal, water, candy, chips, soda, and souvenirs. The staff in the Bistro was very helpful and didn’t mind answering questions. The Bistro closes fairly early (3pm) then the Bar takes over. You are still able to order a little something to eat at this time if you wish. If you go down Atlantic Blvd (by bus its about a 10 minute ride) there are several restuarants such as TGIF, Ruby Tuesday's, McDonalds, and Red Lobster. Ordering in is expensive. A small cheese pizza and an order or wings from Papa John's is $20. I did not have access to a car while I was there and felt a bit handicapped in terms of being able to get around. However, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel. Most buses run on a 30mintue to 1 hour schdule so be prepared. If you want to be able to get around the city, it's more convenient to have your own transportation. If I went back to the Americano, I would be sure to rent a car. Overall, it was a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay-beware of pushy RCI sales pitch”
Reviews.Author: marmieKy
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed several vacations at this resort. This stay we found a focus on the RCI points exchange program. Being a timeshare owner, not everyone is interested in this program. Understand that and listen to your guest/owner. Good customer service has always been a top priority with this resort and didn't find that this visit with the current sales staff. Otherwise, things were great, as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Atomsphere”
Reviews.Author: DThompson64
Reviews.Content: Went for our honeymoon on a gift certificate. Most people staying have timeshares but it was great. They were in the process of upgrading the rooms with Flat Screen HDTV. It is on the beach with a beautiful view especially at night. We seen dolphins out side of windows. They have an indoor and outdoor pool, fitness room, indoor and outdoor whirlpool, gameroom, bar, cafe, internet service, security, security codes for all doors, beach access, bbq grills. Everything and anything that you need they have. We decide to purchase a timeshare there too. Go and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “More of a glorified hotel than resort”
Reviews.Author: Docsports
Reviews.Content: I would like to first off by saying that everything people had to say about the staff are true. They are very helpful and will do whatever they can to make your stay enjoyable. But this is an old property and appears to be a converted hotel. The rooms are adequate but outdated. The furniture was not comfortable but was in good condition. The room had a good view of the beach. Speaking of the beach this timeshare is a little further down than the action which could be a good thing. There is much less traffic than further south, but there were no beach rentals (chairs, etc.) unlike further south. There is a small grill in the lobby with typical grill fare, but you would be better off cooking in your room. There is a small bar and they do have drink specials. The exercise room looks better in the pictures than it did in person. It is fairly small with a few machines and there were kids playing on them a lot of the time. There is an indoor pool and two hot tubs. The outdoor pool is very impressive. There is quite a bit of seating and sunbathing area. It was never full the whole time we were there. Unfortunately the way they built the wall around the pool area you cannot see the beach very well. Check out was kind of a hassle. There were about two hundred people leaving and there was only one poor employee on the desk. She was wonderful and worked her tail off, but it did take some time to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation/Wedding”
Reviews.Author: rday13
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Americano was excellent. We had our wedding there on 06/12/08. The Americano helped us out every way possbile to help make our wedding memorable. I want to say "Thank you" to the staff at Americano for all their help. They assisted with everything that we needed. Our reception was held in the sales office and it was beautiful. I also want to "Thank You" to Georgette for all of her help and giving us the opportunity to share this speacial moment at the Americano. We really appreciate everything you and your staff did for us. Americano is a great place to stay. We enjoyed our stay and can't wait to come back next year. Once again " Thanks again" for everything. It really meant alot to us and our families. Ryan and Lynn Day

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmed at the quality of our stay”
Reviews.Author: wtrmelon57
Reviews.Content: The Americano Beach Resort in Daytona Beach Florida. [----] My family stayed at the Resort last week and had the best time I have ever experienced in a hotel setting Thanx to the entire staff. What a fantastic crew...The staff went above and beyond the call to make our stay GREAT. My son and his fiance' were married on the beach in front of the resort and the help we got from the staff was Fantastic. Every question was answered and every problem was solved on the spot. With a smile! It is a great feeling when someone goes out of thier way to make you feel at home. William was our go to man for help with our party he helped us cleanup and went out of his way to make it easy. Cecelia I think is her name in housekeeping always had a smile was very helpful with getting anything we needed to have a comfortable stay. The front desk was so helpful with check-in and check-out procedures that we didnt even feel as though we were at a hotel we felt like we owned the place. When my wife and I return to Daytona that is where we will stay if they have the room . As long as I get the room with the pool and beach view:) Again thanks to the entire staff for all their help IT WAS A GREAT VACATION!!!!. I will recommend The Americano to anyone that asks me where to stay in Daytona. Its location is perfect for getting to the race track or Main street where the pier is. I had a blast fishing there. The grocery stores and rest. and shopping centers are even closer. Anyone looking needas to stay there. Thanx again...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Taylorlaux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Resort for the week and really enjoyed the time. Our two bedroom condo faced the North with views of the Ocean and the River. I was really amazed at how clean the entire property was. Our room had a full kitchen with everything we needed and two bathrooms! The boys really liked the Pirate ship playground and the kiddie pool. It was hard to keep them out of the huge arcade when we wanted to play board games in the game room! The staff was more than accomodating and treated us as if we were friends! Taylor Family

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!!!”
Reviews.Author: bubblesNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We found this place in a coupon book and were so delighted when we arrived! This place is absolutly gorgeous! We rented a studio unit that would sleep up to four people. The room was very clean and it had a wonderful view of the ocean and the pooldeck. There were activities through out the day such as water aerobics and bingo (no extra charge). We have never encountered a more accommodating staff. They were very pleasant and willing to help with ANYTHING we needed. The deli in the looby has very good food, from breakfast to dinner and it was very affordable. We will definitly be booking at the Americano Beach Resort again for our future family vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Mold / Dirty / Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: FloridiaMiami
Reviews.Content: Terrible mistake by booking a full week. The mold story and dirty room is real. We had 2 suites on the 5th floor and they moved us out to the 9th floor. Same thing, great view and location, but very poor maintenance. If I where you book someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From Desert Inn & Resort”
Reviews.Author: dreameeworld
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 Beachfront Suites-both rooms were filthy, black mold on the ceiling and walls, the stench of mold was overwhelming we checked out after one night. We were not the only ones-there was a line of people checking out after staying only one night-all for the same reason. Also no manager was on duty to issue credits to all checking out! Do not ruin your vacation-stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the ugly american”
Reviews.Author: briish
Reviews.Content: was during bike week and hectic, nice on the beach and safe storage for the bikes, staff was friendly, relaxed and laid back atmosphere nice pool would stay again not far from the action

HotelInfo.Name: Americano Beach Lodge Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1260 North Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
